column2: Tatebayashi-shi) is a city located in Gunma Prefecture

column7: and a population density of 1200 persons per km². The total area of the city is 60.97 square kilometres (23.54 sq mi). Tatebayashi is famous for Azalea Hill Park and Bunbuku Chagama of Morin-ji temple.

column1: Tatebayashi is located in the extreme southeastern portion of Gunma Prefecture in the Kantō Plains
column2: bordered by Tochigi Prefecture to the north. The Tone River and Watarase Rivers sandwich the city to the north and south.

column1: Tatebayashi has a Humid continental climate (Köppen Cfa) characterized by warm summers and cold winters with heavy snowfall.  The average annual temperature in Tatebayashi is 14.5 °C. The average annual rainfall is 1287 mm with September as the wettest month. The temperatures are highest on average in August

column2: the population of Tatebayashi has increased steadily over the past 100 years. There is a small community of around 200 Rohingya from Myanmar living in Tatebayashi.

column1: Tatebayashi is located within traditional Kōzuke Province and has been settled since prehistoric times and there is a continuous record of habitation fro the Japanese Paleolithic period 20
column2: 000 years ago. During the Edo period
column3: the area of present-day Tatebayashi was a castle town and administrative center of Tatebayashi Domain
column4: a feudal domain under the Tokugawa shogunate.

column1: Tatebayashi Town was created within Ōra District
column3: 1889 with the creation of the modern municipalities system after the Meiji Restoration. On April 1
column4: 1954 the town of Tatebayashi and the villages of Satoya
column10: and Watarase merged to form the city Tatebayashi.

column1: Tatebayashi has a mayor-council form of government with a directly elected mayor and a unicameral city council of 18 members. Tatebayashi contributes two members to the Gunma Prefectural Assembly. In terms of national politics
column2: the city is part of Gunma 3rd district of the lower house of the Diet of Japan.

column1: Tatebayashi is a regional commercial center and transportation hub. Food processing dominates the manufacturing sector of the local economy.
Tatebayashi has 11 public elementary schools and five public middle schools operated by the city government
column2: and two public high schools operated by the Gunma Prefectural Board of Education. There is also one private high school.
